result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Lee Schleusner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Removed from Payment Plan - Missed Payments Allowed - Collection action done

Defendant, Richard L Schleusner, appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Diane Wood Webster.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(8:46)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - pleading to misd battery - 16CM123 dismissed - plead to 16CM80 as dom w/held sent 24 prob - COP 20 days jail or 150 CS he's completed 27 hrs CS - nc E.D. or AMW 5/20/04 unless approved by agent - AODA - dom abuse assess - $543
victim rights were complied with in 16CM80 but victim wasn't notified in 16CM123 - will let victim know of resolution

Deft - 16CM80 waives rights, attorney - pleads guilty - waives jury trial - ED is living with him she has no place to live and was supposed to come in and drop the no contact

COURT:  16CM80 plea voluntary - finds deft guilty
w/held sentence 24 months probation
$243 cc
$200 dna surchg
$100 dom abuse surchg
***PAYMENT PLAN***
  CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
20 days jail or 150 hrs community service - have  community service done within 18 months
no abusive contact with ED or AMW 5/20/04 unless approved by agent
AODA & follow thru
Domestic abuse assessment
Credit one day if revoked

DISMISS & READ-IN: 16CM123
